instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> white screen
threads.message:
i got a water damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with destroyed lcd connector , resistors and caps around lcd connector very bad shape , and other corroded stuff , i replace everything that was looking bad , including the lcd connector , now machine power on , i hear the chime , mouse lights , ram reset is works , but i get no display only a white screen, no question mark folder , no nothing else , i did triple check lcd connector pin by pin.

where i can start?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> white screen
threads.message: never mind about this one <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> was damaged , nothing was getting to L9004 i replaced and rebuild a trace for the enable and now i get display , I'm very confuse , i did have the idea that without voltage on l9004 i will get nothing on the lcd , and on this one , it did light and have a white display. anyway its fix.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> white screen
threads.message:
hello before closing this i want to share that <SIGNAL>LVDS_IG_A_DATA_N</SIGNAL><1> pin 11 on the lcd connector at the end was not solder right and i was getting dots on the apple , like purple dots , around it , and around the loading bar , so i guess triple check needs one extra check sometimes.

so <SIGNAL>PP3V3_LCDVDD_SW_F</SIGNAL> was missing and found that solved this white screen.
